ACT
249
Court supervision
A notary public cannot, except for particularly justified reasons, refuse entrusted work.
The justification of the reasons from paragraph 1 of this article shall be decided by the court that entrusted him with the work.
Supervision of the work of a public notary as a court commissioner is performed by the court that entrusted him with the work.
When the notary public refuses the entrusted work or when the court takes away the entrusted work, the court will order the notary public to hand over the files and ex officio execute its order.
The court may fine a notary public who refuses to carry out the order of the court or refuses to hand over to the court the files on the entrusted work. Regarding this penalty, the provisions of the Enforcement Act on penalties are applied accordingly.
An appeal to the second-instance court is allowed against the sentence decision.
Extraordinary legal remedies are not allowed against the decision of the second-instance court.
